properties.name: camel.component.netty.allow-default-codec
properties.description: The netty component installs a default codec if both, encoder/decoder is null and textline is false. Setting allowDefaultCodec to false prevents the netty component from installing a default codec as the first element in the filter chain.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.allow-serialized-headers
properties.description: Only used for TCP when transferExchange is true. When set to true, serializable objects in headers and properties will be added to the exchange. Otherwise Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.auto-append-delimiter
properties.description: Whether or not to auto append missing end delimiter when sending using the textline codec.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.backlog
properties.description: Allows to configure a backlog for netty consumer (server). Note the backlog is just a best effort depending on the OS. Setting this option to a value such as 200, 500 or 1000, tells the TCP stack how long the accept queue can be If this option is not configured, then the backlog depends on OS setting.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.boss-count
properties.description: When netty works on nio mode, it uses default bossCount parameter from Netty, which is 1. User can use this option to override the default bossCount from Netty

properties.name: camel.component.netty.boss-group
properties.description: Set the BossGroup which could be used for handling the new connection of the server side across the NettyEndpoint. The option is a io.netty.channel.EventLoopGroup type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.broadcast
properties.description: Setting to choose Multicast over UDP

properties.name: camel.component.netty.channel-group
properties.description: To use a explicit ChannelGroup. The option is a io.netty.channel.group.ChannelGroup type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.client-initializer-factory
properties.description: To use a custom ClientInitializerFactory. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.netty.ClientInitializerFactory type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.client-mode
properties.description: If the clientMode is true, netty consumer will connect the address as a TCP client.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.configuration
properties.description: To use the NettyConfiguration as configuration when creating endpoints. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.netty.NettyConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.connect-timeout
properties.description: Time to wait for a socket connection to be available. Value is in milliseconds.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.correlation-manager
properties.description: To use a custom correlation manager to manage how request and reply messages are mapped when using request/reply with the netty producer. This should only be used if you have a way to map requests together with replies such as if there is correlation ids in both the request and reply messages. This can be used if you want to multiplex concurrent messages on the same channel (aka connection) in netty. When doing this you must have a way to correlate the request and reply messages so you can store the right reply on the inflight Camel Exchange before its continued routed. We recommend extending the TimeoutCorrelationManagerSupport when you build custom correlation managers. This provides support for timeout and other complexities you otherwise would need to implement as well. See also the producerPoolEnabled option for more details. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.netty.NettyCamelStateCorrelationManager type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.decoder-max-line-length
properties.description: The max line length to use for the textline codec.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.decoders
properties.description: A list of decoders to be used. You can use a String which have values separated by comma, and have the values be looked up in the Registry. Just remember to prefix the value with # so Camel knows it should lookup.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.delimiter
properties.description: The delimiter to use for the textline codec. Possible values are LINE and NULL.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.disconnect
properties.description: Whether or not to disconnect(close) from Netty Channel right after use. Can be used for both consumer and producer.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.disconnect-on-no-reply
properties.description: If sync is enabled then this option dictates NettyConsumer if it should disconnect where there is no reply to send back.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the netty component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.enabled-protocols
properties.description: Which protocols to enable when using SSL

properties.name: camel.component.netty.encoders
properties.description: A list of encoders to be used. You can use a String which have values separated by comma, and have the values be looked up in the Registry. Just remember to prefix the value with # so Camel knows it should lookup.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.encoding
properties.description: The encoding (a charset name) to use for the textline codec. If not provided, Camel will use the JVM default Charset.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.executor-service
properties.description: To use the given EventExecutorGroup. The option is a io.netty.util.concurrent.EventExecutorGroup type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.hostname-verification
properties.description: To enable/disable hostname verification on SSLEngine

properties.name: camel.component.netty.keep-alive
properties.description: Setting to ensure socket is not closed due to inactivity

properties.name: camel.component.netty.key-store-file
properties.description: Client side certificate keystore to be used for encryption

properties.name: camel.component.netty.key-store-format
properties.description: Keystore format to be used for payload encryption. Defaults to JKS if not set

properties.name: camel.component.netty.key-store-resource
properties.description: Client side certificate keystore to be used for encryption. Is loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.lazy-channel-creation
properties.description: Channels can be lazily created to avoid exceptions, if the remote server is not up and running when the Camel producer is started.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.maximum-pool-size
properties.description: Sets a maximum thread pool size for the netty consumer ordered thread pool. The default size is 2 x cpu_core plus 1. Setting this value to eg 10 will then use 10 threads unless 2 x cpu_core plus 1 is a higher value, which then will override and be used. For example if there are 8 cores, then the consumer thread pool will be 17. This thread pool is used to route messages received from Netty by Camel. We use a separate thread pool to ensure ordering of messages and also in case some messages will block, then nettys worker threads (event loop) wont be affected.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.native-transport
properties.description: Whether to use native transport instead of NIO. Native transport takes advantage of the host operating system and is only supported on some platforms. You need to add the netty JAR for the host operating system you are using. See more details at: http://netty.io/wiki/native-transports.html

properties.name: camel.component.netty.need-client-auth
properties.description: Configures whether the server needs client authentication when using SSL.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.netty-server-bootstrap-factory
properties.description: To use a custom NettyServerBootstrapFactory. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.netty.NettyServerBootstrapFactory type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.network-interface
properties.description: When using UDP then this option can be used to specify a network interface by its name, such as eth0 to join a multicast group.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.no-reply-log-level
properties.description: If sync is enabled this option dictates NettyConsumer which logging level to use when logging a there is no reply to send back.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.options
properties.description: Allows to configure additional netty options using option. as prefix. For example option.child.keepAlive=false to set the netty option child.keepAlive=false. See the Netty documentation for possible options that can be used.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.passphrase
properties.description: Password setting to use in order to encrypt/decrypt payloads sent using SSH

properties.name: camel.component.netty.producer-pool-enabled
properties.description: Whether producer pool is enabled or not. Important: If you turn this off then a single shared connection is used for the producer, also if you are doing request/reply. That means there is a potential issue with interleaved responses if replies comes back out-of-order. Therefore you need to have a correlation id in both the request and reply messages so you can properly correlate the replies to the Camel callback that is responsible for continue processing the message in Camel. To do this you need to implement NettyCamelStateCorrelationManager as correlation manager and configure it via the correlationManager option. See also the correlationManager option for more details.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.producer-pool-max-active
properties.description: Sets the cap on the number of objects that can be allocated by the pool (checked out to clients, or idle awaiting checkout) at a given time. Use a negative value for no limit.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.producer-pool-max-idle
properties.description: Sets the cap on the number of idle instances in the pool.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.producer-pool-min-evictable-idle
properties.description: Sets the minimum amount of time (value in millis) an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.producer-pool-min-idle
properties.description: Sets the minimum number of instances allowed in the producer pool before the evictor thread (if active) spawns new objects.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.receive-buffer-size
properties.description: The TCP/UDP buffer sizes to be used during inbound communication. Size is bytes.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.receive-buffer-size-predictor
properties.description: Configures the buffer size predictor. See details at Jetty documentation and this mail thread.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.reconnect
properties.description: Used only in clientMode in consumer, the consumer will attempt to reconnect on disconnection if this is enabled

properties.name: camel.component.netty.reconnect-interval
properties.description: Used if reconnect and clientMode is enabled. The interval in milli seconds to attempt reconnection

properties.name: camel.component.netty.request-timeout
properties.description: Allows to use a timeout for the Netty producer when calling a remote server. By default no timeout is in use. The value is in milli seconds, so eg 30000 is 30 seconds. The requestTimeout is using Netty's ReadTimeoutHandler to trigger the timeout.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.reuse-address
properties.description: Setting to facilitate socket multiplexing

properties.name: camel.component.netty.reuse-channel
properties.description: This option allows producers and consumers (in client mode) to reuse the same Netty Channel for the lifecycle of processing the Exchange. This is useful if you need to call a server multiple times in a Camel route and want to use the same network connection. When using this, the channel is not returned to the connection pool until the Exchange is done; or disconnected if the disconnect option is set to true. The reused Channel is stored on the Exchange as an exchange property with the key NettyConstants#NETTY_CHANNEL which allows you to obtain the channel during routing and use it as well.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.security-provider
properties.description: Security provider to be used for payload encryption. Defaults to SunX509 if not set.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.send-buffer-size
properties.description: The TCP/UDP buffer sizes to be used during outbound communication. Size is bytes.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.server-closed-channel-exception-caught-log-level
properties.description: If the server (NettyConsumer) catches an java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException then its logged using this logging level. This is used to avoid logging the closed channel exceptions, as clients can disconnect abruptly and then cause a flood of closed exceptions in the Netty server.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.server-exception-caught-log-level
properties.description: If the server (NettyConsumer) catches an exception then its logged using this logging level.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.server-initializer-factory
properties.description: To use a custom ServerInitializerFactory. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.netty.ServerInitializerFactory type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.ssl
properties.description: Setting to specify whether SSL encryption is applied to this endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.netty.ssl-client-cert-headers
properties.description: When enabled and in SSL mode, then the Netty consumer will enrich the Camel Message with headers having information about the client certificate such as subject name, issuer name, serial number, and the valid date range.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.ssl-handler
properties.description: Reference to a class that could be used to return an SSL Handler. The option is a io.netty.handler.ssl.SslHandler type.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.sync
properties.description: Setting to set endpoint as one-way or request-response

properties.name: camel.component.netty.tcp-no-delay
properties.description: Setting to improve TCP protocol performance

properties.name: camel.component.netty.textline
properties.description: Only used for TCP. If no codec is specified, you can use this flag to indicate a text line based codec; if not specified or the value is false, then Object Serialization is assumed over TCP - however only Strings are allowed to be serialized by default.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.transfer-exchange
properties.description: Only used for TCP. You can transfer the exchange over the wire instead of just the body. The following fields are transferred: In body, Out body, fault body, In headers, Out headers, fault headers, exchange properties, exchange exception. This requires that the objects are serializable. Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.trust-store-file
properties.description: Server side certificate keystore to be used for encryption

properties.name: camel.component.netty.trust-store-resource
properties.description: Server side certificate keystore to be used for encryption. Is loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.udp-byte-array-codec
properties.description: For UDP only. If enabled the using byte array codec instead of Java serialization protocol.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.udp-connectionless-sending
properties.description: This option supports connection less udp sending which is a real fire and forget. A connected udp send receive the PortUnreachableException if no one is listen on the receiving port.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.use-byte-buf
properties.description: If the useByteBuf is true, netty producer will turn the message body into ByteBuf before sending it out.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.use-global-ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.using-executor-service
properties.description: Whether to use ordered thread pool, to ensure events are processed orderly on the same channel.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.worker-count
properties.description: When netty works on nio mode, it uses default workerCount parameter from Netty (which is cpu_core_threads x 2). User can use this option to override the default workerCount from Netty.

properties.name: camel.component.netty.worker-group
properties.description: To use a explicit EventLoopGroup as the boss thread pool. For example to share a thread pool with multiple consumers or producers. By default each consumer or producer has their own worker pool with 2 x cpu count core threads. The option is a io.netty.channel.EventLoopGroup type.
